title: Delph Woods Walking Route

images.title: Chris Downer / Merley: footbridge over stream in Delph Woods
images.caption: Merley, footbridge over stream in Delph Woods. A small footbridge crosses this little stream, immediately south of the Broadstone cricket field.

images.title: Chris Downer / Merley: stream and bridge in Delph Woods
images.caption: One of the main tracks, also a bridleway, crosses the stream by way of this low brick bridge.

images.title: Chris Downer / Merley: bench in Delph Woods
images.caption: A small bench on the westward path in Delph Woods, an ideal place to sit and relax  most of those who do so probably watch as their dogs play!

images.title: Chris Downer / Merley: a clearing in Delph Woods
images.caption: Looking across the width of this narrow clearing from just in the woods on its western side.

images.title: Castleman Trail by Derek Harper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Castleman Trail

images.title: Chris Downer / Merley: lofty tree in Delph Woods
images.caption: This magnificent tree stands in a sort of mini-clearing in Delph Woods, making it not only one of the most conspicuous individuals but also probably one of the farthest from its neighbours.

images.title: Mike Faherty / Delph Woods, old gravel pit
images.caption: One of several ponds in Delph Woods, once a site for gravel and clay extraction; presumably a former gravel pit.

images.title: Chris Downer / Merley: cricket ground in Delph Woods
images.caption: Merley: Broadstone Cricket Club ground in the woods. This cricket field forms a large clearing in Delph Woods, and belings to Canford School, a select independent school a couple of miles to the northwest.

description: This woodland nature reserve is located near Corfe Mullen , Wimborne and Poole in Dorset. The site includes a small car park and some pleasant shady footpaths running along a pretty stream. It's a peaceful place with lots of woodland birds to listen and look out for. The Castleman Trailway runs along the western side of the woods. You could pick up this shared cycling and walking trail and follow it south to visit Upton Heath and Upton Country Park . The historic minster at Wimborne lies just to the north.
